p: Approximately one hundred 4–5 day-old mosquitoes were placed into 750 ml containers with gauze covering the opening. Stocks of DENV2 QML16 and QML22 were thawed and immediately mixed with defibrinated sheep blood to contain 10 8 CCID 50/ml. The mosquitoes, in containers, were allowed to feed for 1 h on the blood/virus mixtures through bovine caecum membrane using an artificial feeding apparatus maintained at 37 °C, as previously described [ 21]. After feeding, mosquitoes were anaesthetized using CO 2, placed on a Petri dish on ice and fully engorged females were separated from unfed or partially fed mosquitoes. The engorged mosquitoes were placed into the gauze covered containers, provided with cotton balls soaked with 10% sugar solution, and maintained within an environmental chamber (PHCbi, PA, USA) set at 28 °C, 75% relative humidity and 12:12 h day:night light schedule with 30 min dawn:dusk periods.
